body_html:
I am facing similar problems. I am trying to run TensorFlow at work, on my RHEL 6.8 box. IT will not let us use package managers, and we cannot upgrade the bundled python, or gcc.
I tried to get around this by installing Python 2.7, TensorFlow, and latest GCC locally on the box in /scratch
I update LD_LIBRARY_PATH to point to my own copy of GCC shared libraries. It seems that tensorflow does not care about LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and it is searching in /lib64/libc.so.6 for GLIBC_2.16

body:
I am facing similar problems. I am trying to run TensorFlow at work, on my RHEL 6.8 box. IT will not let us use package managers, and we cannot upgrade the bundled python, or gcc.
I tried to get around this by installing Python 2.7, TensorFlow, and latest GCC locally on the box in /scratch
I update LD_LIBRARY_PATH to point to my own copy of GCC shared libraries. It seems that tensorflow does not care about LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and it is searching in /lib64/libc.so.6 for GLIBC_2.16
